greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Determinant of n X n matrix containing the first n^2 4-almost primes in increasing order.
comment: 4-almost prime analog of A067276 Determinant of n X n matrix containing the first n^2 primes in increasing order. The first column contains the first n 4-almost primes (A014613) in increasing order, the second column contains the next n 4-almost primes in increasing order, etc. Equivalently, first row contains first n 4-almost primes in increasing order, second row contains next n 4-almost primes in increasing order, etc. See also: A118713 a(n) = semiprime circulant.
example: a(3) = 0 because this matrix is singular: 0 =
mathematica: FourAlmostPrimePi[n_] := Sum[PrimePi[n/(Prime@i*Prime@j*Prime@k)] - k + 1, {i, PrimePi[n^(1/4)]}, {j, i, PrimePi[(n/Prime@i)^(1/3)]}, {k, j, PrimePi@Sqrt[n/(Prime@i*Prime@j)]}]; FourAlmostPrime[n_] := Block[{e = Floor[Log[2, n] + 1], a, b}, a = 2^e; Do[b = 2^p; While[FourAlmostPrimePi[a] < n, a = a + b]; a = a - b/2, {p, e, 0, -1}]; a + b/2]; Table[Det[Partition[Array[FourAlmostPrime, n^2], n]], {n, 17}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 26 2006 *)
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, May 22 2006
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 26 2006
